title: Is opinionated news considered fake news? - Quora

response.answer_text: Opinionated news is not news at all. The opinion area of the paper is not news, it’s just opinion, an editorial. It’s a single person’s point of view. They may talk about the news, but it’s not a news article by definition. Now when it comes to CNN, MSNBC, and Fox, they really need to stop injected opinion into news. News doesn’t care about feelings. The news is to be reported. Who, what, when, how, and why (if possible). Any opinions tend to bias the news. Biasing the news means you are manipulating the person reading to follow your point of view over simply reporting the news. These can appear in words that offer editorial comments over just the news. For example, take this article from AP Primary night: Dems go for diversity, GOP for Trump choices It manipulates the reader to side with the democrats and paints the GOP in a very negative light through the use of language. A person should make that decision on their own. The article should simply report the news, and not include a language that manipulates the reader. The article above is a perfect example of opinionated news. It’s not fake news, it’s just not news. It should be in the editorial section.
